intro: Drimia serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering African lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its strap-like, grass-like leaves. The plant produces tall, slender flowering stems that bear clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Drimia serotina is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and seasonal blooming.
